div.head: Memorandum From Henry Bardach (Director of Systematic Review) to William Slany (Director of the Historian’s Office)
div.p: Subject: Preliminary Review of Volume X, Foreign Relations of the United States, 1951-1954, “Iran”

1. The Classification/Declassification Center has completed its preliminary review of this volume. Coordination with the United Kingdom has been completed and is taken into account in this summary of results. Coordination with other agencies, excepting CIA, has been initiated as indicated. The results of inter-agency coordination will be relayed to HO as received. At that time clearance will be sought from NSC. When final approval has been obtained authorization to publish will be communicated to HO.

2. As a result of this review all documents proposed for publication in Volume X have been cleared for declassification with the exception of the following documents which must be denied (TAB A), or withheld pending clearance with other agencies (TAB B), or excised (TAB C). Copies of all excised pages are enclosed at TAB D.
3. It is requested that HO prepare a complete set of the Volume X documents to be forwarded by A/CDC/SR to CIA for review.
